channel.title: xdebug php on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in xdebug php on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Inspect return values with XDebug
item.description: When working with a PHP codebase I really like to use XDebug as a way to find my way around and getting a grasp on what’s going on. One thing that annoyed me a bit was that in order to inspect return values of methods, I had to assign them to a dedicated variable. This doesn’t sound like a problem, but there can be a bunch of reasons why you don’t want to change the code for this.
